question.text: Which art movement, characterized by dreamlike imagery and irrational scenes, is exemplified by Salvador Dalí's "The Persistence of Memory," featuring melting clocks?
"Guernica," a powerful anti-war painting depicting the bombing of a Basque town, was created by which influential Spanish artist?
Which artistic style, using small, distinct dots of color applied in patterns to form an image, is famously employed in Georges Seurat's "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte"?
Jan van Eyck's "Arnolfini Portrait" is renowned for its realisti detail and symbolism. What innovation in painting technique is he often credited with pioneering?
Often referred to as the greatest Mughal painter, which artist is renowned for his naturalisti depictions of animals and court scenes, as seen in the "Baburnama"?
Known for capturing fleeting moments and atmospheri conditions, which French movement is exemplified by Claude Monet's "Impression, Sunrise"?
Which artist, known for his expressive brushstrokes and emotional intensity, created "The Starry Night," depiction of the view from his asylum window?

options.option: Vincent van Gogh c) Edvard Munch

question.text: "The Birth of Venus," masterpiece of the Italian Renaissance, was painted by which Florentine artist, known for his elegant and graceful figures?
Raj pioneer of modern Indian art, is famous for his paintings depicting scenes from which Indian epics and mythology? Ramayana and Mahabharata
Which art style, breaking objects into fragments and reassembling them in an abstract form, is seen in Pablo Picasso's "Les Demoiselles d'Avignon"?
Leonardo d

options.option: Vinci's "Mona Lisa" is famed for its enigmatic smile and mastery of sfumato. What does "sfumato" refer to?
Blurring of outlines c) Detailed textures

question.text: Known for its bold use of color and simplified forms, which movement is Henri Matisse, the French artist associated with, as seen in "The Dance"?
"The Night Watch," large and dramatic group portrait, is signature work by which Dutch Baroque painter, renowned for his use of light and shadow? Johannes Vermeer
The Bengal School of Art, which promoted indigenous techniques and themes, was led by which influential Indian artist, known for his painting "Bharat Mata"?
Which art movement, emerging in Italy in the early 20th century, celebrated technology, speed, and the dynamism of modern life, as seen in Umberto Boccioni's "Unique Forms of Continuity in Space"?
Michelangelo's "The Creation of Adam," part of the Sistine Chapel ceiling, depicts famous biblical scene. Which figures are represented in the painting?

options.option: God and Adam c) Jesus and John the Baptist

question.text: Known for her self-portraits exploring themes of identity, pain, and the human body, which Mexican artist is celebrated for her surrealist and deeply personal works?
Which Japanese art form, involving woodblock printing, became popular during the Edo period and influenced Impressionist artists like Edgar Degas and Mary Cassatt?
Amrit

options.option: Sher-Gil, an important figure in Indian art, blended Western and Indian styles. Which themes did she often explore in her paintings of rural India?
Poverty and social inequality c) Love and romance

question.text: Which Russian art movement, characterized by geometri shapes and abstraction, was founded by Kazimir Malevich, known for his "Black Square"?
Raphael's "The School of Athens" celebrates the pursuit of knowledge. Which ancient Greek philosophers are featured prominently in the painting?
The Pop art movement, which embraced consumer culture, found one of its leaders in which American artist who immortalized Campbell's soup cans and Marilyn Monroe?
Leonardo d wall painting that depicts the last supper. In which building is it housed? St. Peter's Basilica
The Fauvist art movement is well known for its use of color, which artist pioneered it?
Which Indian painting style is well known for its use of bright colors and Hindu mythological themes?
Vincent Van Gogh, the famous artist, was not always an artist- what was his primary occupation before that?
What is the primary trait for which the Mughal paintings are so well known?
Who painted the famous "Girl with the Pearl Earring"
Which art movement aimed to depict the world as it is?
What is the primary subject of the "Starry Night"?
Which style was pioneered by Jackson Pollock?
How did Diego River highlight the values of the Mexican people? by making war paintings by painting about their daily life c) by painting portraits
Which form of Indian paintings are done on cloth?
Which one of these movements is best known for its focus on movement and motion?
In which style was "The scream" painted?
Which country is known as the birth place of impressionism?
The painter Leonardo d

options.option: Vinci only had very few paintings that were considered his own... Why is that?
He always signed the work as 'anonymous'
He used to get bored and leave the project in the middle c) He could not create paintings at all

Associated with geometri shapes and patterns, is which ancient style of painting?

Which artist was an impressionist

section.name: FOLK DANCES AND FESTIVALS OF INDIA

question.text: What is the name of the energetic folk dance from Punjab, traditionally performed during the harvest season?
Bhangra
Giddha

Yakshagana
Dollu Kunitha
Karagattam

Vempati Chinna Satyam

Balasaraswati

Karagattam

Lavani

question.text: Manoj Night Shyamalan's directorial debut involved him starring in his own venture. What was the title of this early film project? The Sixth Sense

options.option: The Sixth Sense b) Praying with Anger c) Signs

question.text: The Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, India's first international biosphere reserve, spans across which states? Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka

options.option: Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka b) Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Odisha c) Maharashtra, Gujarat, Rajasthan

question.text: Before becoming a global cycle manufacturer, Hero Cycles started its operations in Ludhiana. What was the company's initial focus? Manufacturing auto parts

options.option: Manufacturing auto parts b) Distributing bicycles c) Producing steel components

question.text: Mukurthi National Park, protecting the Nilgiri Tahr, is renowned for its unique ecosystem. What type of forest dominates this national park? Tropical rainforest

options.option: Tropical rainforest b) Montane grasslands and shrublands c) Mangrove forest

question.text: Zatalli, who faced a death sentence for criticizing Emperor Farukhsiyar, was known for his mastery over several languages. Besides Hindi, which other languages did he excel in? Sanskrit and Urdu

options.option: Sanskrit and Urdu b) Persian and Rekhta c) Arabic and Turkish

question.text: Jahanara Begum, the accomplished daughter of Shah Jahan, played a significant role in the architecture of Delhi. Besides Chandni Chowk, what other major project is she credited with? Red Fort's interior design

options.option: Red Fort's interior design b) Jama Masjid's construction c) Restoration of Agra Fort

question.text: Mirza Abdul Qadir, better known as Bedil, is remembered for his unique style of poetry. What is the defining characteristic of the "Sabk-e-Hindi" school he mastered? Simple and straightforward language

options.option: Simple and straightforward language b) Complex metaphors and philosophical depth c) Romantic and lyrical themes

question.text: Jeet Thayil's debut novel, Narcopolis, shortlisted for the Man Booker Prize, explores which historical setting? Colonial Calcutta

options.option: Colonial Calcutta b) 1970s Bombay's opium dens c) Rural Rajasthan's feudal society

question.text: The British investment of 100 million pounds in Indian railways by 1875 led to the development of the Guaranteed System. What was the primary benefit for the investors under this system? Guaranteed fixed interest on their investment

options.option: Guaranteed fixed interest on their investment b) Ownership of railway lines c) Tax exemptions on profits

question.text: The coalition governments led by Rajendra Narayan Singh Deo and Bishwanath Das in Odisha had a common political party, the Swatantra Party. What was the Swatantra Party's main ideology? Socialism and nationalization

options.option: Socialism and nationalization b) Free market and individual liberty c) Agrarian reform and rural development

question.text: The Ashokastami Mela in Tripura's Kaliashahar sub-division is a Shaiva pilgrimage. Which deity is primarily worshipped during this mela? Lord Vishnu

options.option: Lord Vishnu b) Goddess Durga c) Lord Shiva

question.text: The Lushai Hills, part of the Patkai mountain range in Mizoram, are known for their biodiversity. Which type of vegetation is most common in this region? Alpine meadows

options.option: Alpine meadows b) Tropical evergreen forests c) Arid scrublands

question.text: Williamnagar, the headquarters of East Garo Hills in Meghalaya, is named after Captain Williamson Sangma. What was Captain Sangma's primary role in the region's history? A British colonial officer

options.option: A British colonial officer b) A freedom fighter and political leader c) A renowned social reformer

question.text: The Umshiang Double-Decker Bridge in Cherrapunjee is made of living roots of Ficus elastica. How long does it typically take for such a root bridge to become fully functional? 2-3 years
Jowai, surrounded by the Myntdu River, is known for its caves. What is unique about the cave networks in Lumshnong and Syndai? They contain ancient rock carvings

options.option: They contain ancient rock carvings b) They are among the largest cave networks in Asia c) They have underground waterfalls

question.text: Bomdilla, near the Eaglesnest Wildlife Sanctuary, is inhabited by several tribes. Which is the dominant tribe in this area? Nishi
Bhogeshwar Baruah, the first Arjuna Award winner from Northeast India, excelled in which athletics event at the 1966 Bangkok Asian Games? 100 meters sprint

options.option: 100 meters sprint b) 800 meters race c) Long jump

question.text: Dr. Talimeran Ao, captain of the Indian football team, had a long association with Mohun Bagan. In which year did he retire from professional football? 1950
Romulus Whitaker established the Agumbe Rainforest Research Station with funds from the Whitley Award. What is the primary focus of research at this station? Elephant conservation

options.option: Elephant conservation b) King cobra ecology c) Tiger population dynamics

question.text: Dev Anand's film "Hum Naujawan" marked Tabu's Bollywood debut. What was Tabu's role in this film?
The CTC process is widely used in tea production. What is the main advantage of CTC tea over orthodox tea? Better flavor

options.option: Better flavor b) Faster brewing and stronger color c) Higher antioxidant content

question.text: MCX, or Multi Commodity Exchange of India Limited, facilitates farmers' access to crop-related information. What is the main goal of setting up Gramin Suvidha Kendras? Providing financial assistance to farmers

options.option: Providing financial assistance to farmers b) Educating farmers about market prices c) Promoting organic farming

question.text: Santokben Jadeja, known as the "Godmother," was a controversial figure in Gujarat. What was her primary occupation? Politician

options.option: Politician b) Gang leader c) Social worker

question.text: Ustad Rashid Khan established the Shakhri Begum Memorial Trust in memory of his mother. What is the primary aim of this trust? Promoting women's education

options.option: Promoting women's education b) Supporting classical music c) Providing healthcare to the needy

question.text: General Slim is credited with winning the Battle of Imphal. Which army did he command during this battle? British Indian Army

options.option: British Indian Army b) Japanese Army c) German Army

question.text: The Kerala Congress (Jacob) was formed by T.M. Jacob. What was his main political agenda? Promoting communism

options.option: Promoting communism b) Advocating for farmers' rights c) Supporting regional autonomy

question.text: The Dooars region, with Siliguri as its largest city, is known for its tea gardens. Which type of tea is predominantly grown in this region? Green tea

options.option: Green tea b) Black tea c) White tea

question.text: The O5 group of countries includes India, China, Brazil, Mexico, and South Africa. What is the primary focus of this group?
The Fort St. George museum houses a statue of Lord Cornwallis depicting the surrender of Tipu Sultan's sons. In which Anglo-Mysore War did this event occur? First Anglo-Mysore War

options.option: First Anglo-Mysore War b) Third Anglo-Mysore War c) Fourth Anglo-Mysore War

question.text: Mark Twain's "Following the Equator" chronicles his travels. Which mode of transport did he primarily use during his travels in India? Trains
Mansar Lake, near Jammu, is a popular tourist spot. What is the main religious significance of this lake?
Vinod Mehta's memoir "Lucknow Boy" provides insights into his life. What was his most well-known role in Indian media? Film director

options.option: Film director b) Newspaper editor c) Sports commentator

question.text: Rumtek Monastery, near Gangtok, is the seat of which Buddhist sect? Gelug
The De-notified Tribes in India, comprising 13.51 crore people, face specific challenges. What is the main issue faced by these communities? Lack of access to education

options.option: Lack of access to education b) Social stigma and discrimination c) Environmental degradation

question.text: During the Mysore Dasara procession, the idol of Goddess Chamundeshwari is placed on an elephant. What is the name of the lead elephant that carries the idol? Airavata
The 72 melakarta raga system, developed by Venkatamukhi, is fundamental to which form of music? Hindustani classical music

options.option: Hindustani classical music b) Carnatic classical music c) Folk music

question.text: The NTCA aims to conserve tigers. Which project is primarily associated with tiger conservation in India? Project Elephant

options.option: Project Elephant b) Project Tiger c) Project Snow Leopard

question.text: India First Life Insurance is a joint venture. Which is the primary focus area of this insurance company? Rural insurance

options.option: Rural insurance b) Health insurance c) Life insurance

question.text: The National Research Centre for Grapes in Pune focuses on grape research. Which type of grape is primarily researched at this center? Wine grapes

options.option: Wine grapes b) Table grapes c) Raisin grapes

question.text: Khadi Pratisthan-Sodepur ashram hosted Mahatma Gandhi during a crucial period. What was the main purpose of Gandhi's visit to Noakhali after leaving the ashram? To promote khadi

options.option: To promote khadi b) To restore communal harmony c) To protest against British rule

question.text: The Grizzled Giant Squirrel is found in the Srivilliputhur area. What is the main characteristic that distinguishes this squirrel from other species? Its size and grizzled fur

options.option: Its size and grizzled fur b) Its bright colors c) Its nocturnal habits

question.text: GAGAN, an ISRO-Airport Authority of India venture, is used in aviation. What is the primary benefit of using GAGAN for airline pilots? Improved fuel efficiency

options.option: Improved fuel efficiency b) Enhanced navigational accuracy c) Better communication systems

question.text: Roshanlal Vishwakarma's Bud Chipper is used for pruning sugarcane. What is the main advantage of using this tool? Faster pruning

options.option: Faster pruning b) Reduced labor costs c) Improved plant health

question.text: G. Akash became the youngest winner in men's chess. Which title did he win at the national championship? National Junior Champion

options.option: National Junior Champion b) National Senior Champion c) National Sub-Junior Champion

question.text: Sunil Gangopadhyay's first novel was "Atma Prakash." What is the main theme explored in this novel? Political revolution

options.option: Political revolution b) Self-discovery c) Social injustice

options.option: Kashmir b) Arunachal Pradesh c) Sikkim

question.text: Swami Vivekananda set sail for India in 1896\. Which conference is he best known for attending before this voyage? World Parliament of Religions

question.text: Why is Kerala known as the "spice garden of India"? It's spices are mostly exported to various places in India
